hanzi-su-wiki:
尾

Значения

Хвост; конец; счётный суффикс для рыб

Мнемоника

Волосатый 毛 хвост, растущий из копчика, на котором животные сидят 尸.

koohiiStory1: A dog waves its furry tail like a flag.
koohiiStory2: A FLAG of FUR is a TAIL.
jp_example_words:
尾(お): tail, ridge
尻尾(しっぽ): tail (animal)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You see a flag stuck in the ground with a little bit of fur coming out from it and on closer inspection you realize it’s actually a tail. Someone stuck a flag into some sort of animal, pushing it under the ground. All that’s visible now is some fur and part of the tail.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: What kind of animal could it be? You start to feel the soft fur with your hand and then the stench of death hits your nostrils. Ew.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You try to pull the flag out of the ground and hear a rumbling buzzing sound. At the end of the flagpole you see a huge beehive (び)! These bees made their home under the tail! Maybe that’s why the flag was sticking in it… to warn people. Oops.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: See the bees swarming out from around the tail and toward your face. Run! Run before there’s nothing left of you but your own tail!
Ru_Meaning: tail, end, counter for fish, lower slope of mountain

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the corpse's (尸) fur (毛) is a tail
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A dog waves its furry tail like a flag.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (尾, wei, tail) combines a person and some sort of ornament (毛, mao, hair; fur) behind him. A person has something hanging behind him. Now this symbol means “tail”. Even in the present times, there are nomadic tribes. Some of these people live in hot climates. They usually wear simple coverings made out of leaves. Such covering looks like a tail from the back. In the olden days, China was warmer than today, and people who lived in the middle and southern areas of China could have worn such simple clothing.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jin inscription from " people " to " hair ", like a tail shape behind the buttocks of a person. " Tail " does not mean that people have a tail, but ancient costumes have a tail. "Said Wen": "Tail, Wei Ye. From the beginning to the hair behind the corpse. The ancients may be decorated with the tail, so does the Southwestern barbarian. All tails belong to the tail." Press "Hou Han Shu. Biographies of Nanyi Yi: "After Panhu, all five-colored clothes have tails in sanctions." This shows that Nanyi clothes are decorated with tails. The bronzes seen in Shizhai Mountain, Jinning, Yunnan, can also prove that the people of Yunnan had the habit of wearing tails in their clothes (Wang Ningsheng). The word " servant " in the oracle bone inscriptions is also affixed with a tail, see " servant ".

The meaning of the word " tail " in the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, and it is suspected to be used as the name of the country (Xu Zhongshu, see "Compilation" 136). Bronze " tail " is used as a person's name.

" Tail " is used as the original meaning in the Chu Zhushu of the Warring States Period, "Shanghai Museum III. "Book of Changes" Jane 30: "The sixth day of the sixth day, 遁丌 (the) end, 𥖣 (Li)." It means that the sixth day of the year is the end of the hexagram, and there will be danger (Ji Xusheng).

" Tail " and " micro " ancient characters through. Weishenggao in "The Analects", "Han Shu. "Ancient and Modern People", "Warring States Policy. "Yan Ce" and made the tail high. "Shang Shu. The word "tail tail" in Yaodian, and the word "wei" in "Historical Records" shows that the sound and meaning of the two characters are the same.

The meaning of the word " tail " gradually expanded, extending from the decoration on the back of the person to the tail of an animal, and further extending it to the end, such as the end of the year and the end of the year. In addition, some ancient characters originally started from " tail ", but later changed from the word " corpse " due to changes in the province, see " qu ".
humanum_short_description_en: Jia Jin inscriptions from " people " to " hair ", like a person's buttocks have a tail shape. " Tail " does not mean that people have a tail, but ancient costumes have a tail.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「人」從倒「毛」，象人的臀部後有一尾形。「尾」非人有尾，而是古服飾有尾。《說文》：「尾，微也。从到毛在尸後。古人或飾系尾，西南夷亦然。凡尾之屬皆从尾。」按《後漢書．西南夷列傳》：「槃瓠之後，好五色衣服，製裁皆有尾形」，說明西南夷衣服好以尾作裝飾。雲南晉寧石寨山所見的青銅器，亦可證滇人有衣服帶尾的習慣(汪寧生)。甲骨文「僕」字亦綴尾形，可參見「僕」。

　　甲骨文「尾」字辭義不明，疑用作方國名(徐中舒，參《合集》136正)。金文「尾」字用作人名。

　　「尾」於戰國楚竹書中用作本義，《上博三．周易》簡30：「初六，遯丌(其)尾，𥖣(厲)。」意思是初六爻是遯卦之末尾，將有危險(季旭昇)。

　　「尾」與「微」古字通。《論語》中的微生高，《漢書．古今人表》、《戰國策．燕策》並作尾生高。《尚書．堯典》中「孳尾」一詞，《史記》作「字微」，足見兩字之音義相同。

　　「尾」的詞義逐步擴大，從人背後的裝飾引申為動物的尾巴，進一步引伸成末端的意思，如年尾、尾聲。另外，有些古文字本來從「尾」，後來因省變的關係，都變成了從「尸」的字，參見「屈」。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「人」從倒「毛」，象人的臀部後有一尾形。「尾」非人有尾，而是古服飾有尾。

尾(お): tail, ridge
尻尾(しっぽ): tail (animal)

甲金文從「 人 」從倒「 毛 」，象人的臀部後有一尾形。「 尾 」非人有尾，而是古服飾有尾。《說文》：「尾，微也。从到毛在尸後。古人或飾系尾，西南夷亦然。凡尾之屬皆从尾。」按《後漢書．西南夷列傳》：「槃瓠之後，好五色衣服，製裁皆有尾形」，說明西南夷衣服好以尾作裝飾。雲南晉寧石寨山所見的青銅器，亦可證滇人有衣服帶尾的習慣(汪寧生)。甲骨文「 僕 」字亦綴尾形，可參見「 僕 」。 甲骨文「 尾 」字辭義不明，疑用作方國名(徐中舒，參《合集》136正)。金文「 尾 」字用作人名。 「 尾 」於戰國楚竹書中用作本義，《上博三．周易》簡30：「初六，遯丌(其)尾，𥖣(厲)。」意思是初六爻是遯卦之末尾，將有危險(季旭昇)。 「 尾 」與「 微 」古字通。《論語》中的微生高，《漢書．古今人表》、《戰國策．燕策》並作尾生高。《尚書．堯典》中「孳尾」一詞，《史記》作「字微」，足見兩字之音義相同。 「 尾 」的詞義逐步擴大，從人背後的裝飾引申為動物的尾巴，進一步引伸成末端的意思，如年尾、尾聲。另外，有些古文字本來從「 尾 」，後來因省變的關係，都變成了從「 尸 」的字，參見「 屈 」。
Jia Jin inscription from " people" to " hair", like a tail shape behind the buttocks of a person. " Tail" does not mean that people have a tail, but ancient costumes have a tail. "Said Wen": "Tail, Wei Ye. From the beginning to the hair behind the corpse. The ancients may be decorated with the tail, so does the Southwestern barbarian. All tails belong to the tail." Press "Hou Han Shu. Biographies of Nanyi Yi: "After Panhu, all five-colored clothes have tails in sanctions." This shows that Nanyi clothes are decorated with tails. The bronzes seen in Shizhai Mountain, Jinning, Yunnan, can also prove that the people of Yunnan had the habit of wearing tails in their clothes (Wang Ningsheng). The word " servant" in the oracle bone inscriptions is also affixed with a tail, see " servant". The meaning of the word " tail" in the oracle bone inscriptions is unknown, and it is suspected to be used as the name of the country (Xu Zhongshu, see "Compilation" 136). Bronze " tail" is used as a person's name. " Tail" is used as the original meaning in the Chu Zhushu of the Warring States Period, "Shanghai Museum III. "Book of Changes" Jane 30: "The sixth day of the sixth day, 遁丌 (the) end, 𥖣 (Li)." It means that the sixth day of the year is the end of the hexagram, and there will be danger (Ji Xusheng). " Tail" and " micro" ancient characters through. Weishenggao in "The Analects", "Han Shu. "Ancient and Modern People", "Warring States Policy. "Yan Ce" and made the tail high. "Shang Shu. The word "tail tail" in Yaodian, and the word "wei" in "Historical Records" shows that the sound and meaning of the two characters are the same. The meaning of the word " tail" gradually expanded, extending from the decoration on the back of the person to the tail of an animal, and further extending it to the end, such as the end of the year and the end of the year. In addition, some ancient characters originally started from " tail", but later changed from the word " corpse" due to changes in the province, see " qu".

尾字的基本解释

尾
wěi
鸟兽虫鱼等身体末端突出的部分：尾巴。尾鳍。鸟尾。
末端：排尾。船尾。尾声。尾骨。尾灯。尾数。尾音。结尾。扫尾。虎头蛇尾。
在后面跟：尾随。尾追。
量词，指鱼：三尾鱼。
星名，二十八宿之一。
头首

尾
yǐ
特指马尾（w噄 ）巴上的毛：马尾罗。马尾儿提豆腐―提溜不起来。
特指蟋蟀等尾部的针状物：三尾儿（雌蟋蟀）。
头首

尾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wěi］
［《廣韻》無匪切，上尾，微。］
(1)尾巴。动物躯干末端突出的部分。
(2)末端；末梢。
(3)指边，边緣。
(4)指江河的下游。
(5)终了；末了。
(6)尾随；跟踪。
(7)交尾，交配。
(8)量词。
(9)好貌。
(10)星宿名。二十八宿之一。东方苍龙七宿之第六宿，有星九颗。
(11)姓。汉有尾敦。
[②]［yǐ］
(1)指马尾巴上的毛。
(2)指蟋蟀等昆虫尾部针状物。
(3)方言。尾巴。

尾字的英文翻译

◎ 尾
cauda, offal, trail

尾字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【尸字部】　尾； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页300第16
〔古文〕???【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】無匪切【韻會】武匪切，?音委。【說文】微也。从倒毛在尸後。【玉篇】鳥獸魚蟲皆有之。又末後稍也。【易•未濟】狐濡其尾。【書•君牙】若蹈虎尾。　又【詩•邶風】瑣兮尾兮，流離之子。【註】瑣，細。尾，末也。　又【戰國策】王若能爲此尾。【註】終也。　又東方星名，十八度尾爲大辰。又次名。【禮•月令】日月會於鶉尾，斗建申之辰也。　又底也。【爾雅•釋水】瀵大出尾下。【註】尾猶底也。言其源深出於底下者名瀵。瀵猶灑散也。　又【書•堯典】仲春鳥獸孶尾。【註】乳化曰孳，交接曰尾，因物之生育，驗其氣之和也。　又陪尾，山名，在江夏安陸縣。一名橫尾。一曰負尾。　又姓。【左傳】殷民六族有尾勺氏。又漢劉虞吏尾敦。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋水】瀵大出尾。〕　謹照原文尾下增下字。
尾字的源字形

尾字的起名意思

：指动物的尾巴；末端；在后面跟。引申为末端，边际。

tail
Basic explanation of words
tail
wěi
The protruding part of the end of the body such as birds, beasts, insects, and fish: the tail. Caudal fin. Bird tail.
End: row tail. Stern. end. Tailbone. taillight. mantissa. Ending. end. Mopping up. Anticlimactic.
Followed by: trailing. Tail chase.
Quantifier, refers to fish: three-tailed fish.
Star name, one of twenty-eight places.
Head
tail
yǐ
Especially refers to the hair on the ponytail (w 噄): Ponytail Luo. Mawei'er mentions tofu-can't lift it.
Especially the needles on the tail of crickets: Sanweier (female cricket).
Head
tail
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wěi］
["Guangyun" no bandit cut, upper tail, micro. ]
(1) Tail. The protruding part of an animal's torso.
(2) The end; the tip.
(3) Refers to the edge, the edge.
(4) Refers to the lower reaches of the river.
(5) The end; the end.
(6) Trailing; tracking.
(7) Mating and mating.
(8) Quantifiers.
(9) Good looks.
(10) The name of the stars. One of twenty-eight nights. The sixth place of the seven places of the Eastern Canglong, there are nine stars.
(11) Last name. Han has Odon.
[②]［yǐ］
(1) Refers to the hair on the horse's tail.
(2) Refers to the needles of the tails of insects such as crickets.
(3) Dialects. tail.

Source glyph
tail
Name meaning
: Refers to the tail of an animal; the end; the heel. The extension is the end, the margin.

wěi
尾
尾
尾
一个人在臀部接了一条尾巴
状的饰物,这是远古的人们跳舞
或庆典时模仿兽类或为了表示太
族的图腾而这样做的。《说文》:

хвост
Человек получает на бедре орнамент в виде хвоста, что делали древние люди, имитируя зверей во время танцев или праздников, или изображая тотем тайцзу.
«Саид Вэнь»: «У древних могут быть хвосты».
wěi, yǐ
wěi
I сущ. /счётное слово
1) хвост; хвостатый; хвостовой
鱼类的尾是游泳的工具 хвост у рыб служит им средством для плавания
鱼尾 рыбий хвост
马尾 конский хвост
尾车 хвостовой вагон
有尾目 зоол. хвостатые земноводные
尾滑下落(降) ав. скольжение на хвост
摇尾 вилять хвостом
2) хвост, штука (счётное слово для рыб)
三尾鲤鱼 три карпа
3) хвост, след
彗尾 хвост кометы
4) тыл; с хвоста; сзади, позади; вслед по пятам
出兵尾击诸营 послать войска с тем чтобы ударить на них (противника) в лагере с тыла
附其尾 пристроиться ему в хвост; присоединиться к нему
5) конец; остаток; конечный, последний
无头无尾 без начала и без конца
年尾 конец года
献恒山之尾五城 преподнести в дар пять городов, расположенных в конце хребта Хэншань
6) кит. астр. Вэй, см. 尾宿
II прил.
красивый, прекрасный
琐兮尾兮! так мал и так прекрасен!
III гл.
следовать, идти позади
尾其后 следовать позади него
IV собств. /усл
1) вэй (пятая рифма тона 上 в рифмовниках; пятое число в телеграммах)
2) Вэй (фамилия)
yǐ
см. 尾儿
Radicals: 尸, 毛  (flag, fur)
Meaning Mnemonic
You see a flag stuck in the ground with a little bit of fur coming out from it and on closer inspection you realize it’s actually a tail. Someone stuck a flag into some sort of animal, pushing it under the ground. All that’s visible now is some fur and part of the tail.
What kind of animal could it be? You start to feel the soft fur with your hand and then the stench of death hits your nostrils. Ew.
Reading Mnemonic
You try to pull the flag out of the ground and hear a rumbling buzzing sound. At the end of the flagpole you see a huge beehive (び)! These bees made their home under the tail! Maybe that’s why the flag was sticking in it… to warn people. Oops.
See the bees swarming out from around the tail and toward your face. Run! Run before there’s nothing left of you but your own tail!
